content.question: A student places the object at various locations to the left of the lens and moves the screen to observe focused images. The student uses the data for object distance <math alttext="s sub o" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and image distance <math alttext="s sub i" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to create the graph, drawing a best-fit line to the data. Which of the following represents the focal length of the lens?

choices.label: The magnitude of the line’s slope
The inverse of the magnitude of the line’s slope
The intercept of the line with the horizontal axis
The inverse of the intercept of the line with the vertical axis

content.answer: The inverse of the intercept of the line with the vertical axis

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
